description: The President of Mozambique declares State of Emergency for 30 days, counting from the 1st of April.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Mozambique’s President Filipe Nyusi has extended the State of Emergency for another 30 days. The measures will now run from May 1, 2020 until 30, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Mozambique is extending state of emergency for another 30 days for the second time starting on May 31 2020 until June 29, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Mozambican President Filipe Nyusi announced the extension of the state of emergency for another 30 days for the third time starting from June 30, 2020 until July 29, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Republic of Mozambique, August 8, 2020: the President declared the State of Emergency across the national territory for 30 days until September 6, 2020. Violation will be punished by a penalty of 3 to 15 days in prison. The police will monitor compliance, but the Defense and Security Forces, municipal and local, can also be called in to ensure compliance.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On September 04, 2020, in Mozambique: President Nyusi announced that the state of emergency, will be replaced by a situation of public calamity from September 07, 2020 that will last indefinitely. Failure to obey the regulations can be punished in terms of the legislation on civil disobedience and offences against public health.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Mozambique suspends new visas for Chinese nationals as of January 28.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: Mozambique announces mandatory home quarantine for travellers arriving from countries with more than 1000 confirmed cases of COVID-19 (China, Italy, South Korea, Iran, Germany and France)
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique bans the issuing of entry visas, and cancel visas that have already been issued, measure takes place for 30 days as from March 23 UPDATE: The previous visa restrictions applied only on Chinese nationals, now apply for any new entry visas and cancels the ones already issued.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: Mozambique announces that from March 23 on all travellers, Mozambicans or foreigners, entering the country must go into quarantine for 14 days.. UPDATE: The mandatory home quarantine was previously applied only for citizens, Mozambicans or foreigners,  arriving  from designated countries but it  now applies to any traveller entering the country.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique imposes a mandatory two-week quarantine as of April 1 to everyone who has recently been to another country or has had contact to someone who tested positive for the virus. UPDATE: The two-week mandatory quarantine now applies to everyone who has recently travelled outside the country or has had contact to someone who tested positive for the COVID-19, and not only to incoming passengers.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of January 22, 2020 health authorities in Mozambique started screening all travellers regardless of their nationality.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique bans public or private gatherings of more than 50 people (except those of national interest, such as parliament sessions). UPDATE: The allowed number of people in gatherings has been reduced from 300 to 50 people.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Mozambique prohibits all kinds of events, public or private, including religious services, for 30 days from April 1st. UPDATE: All events, public or private, are suspended until April 30
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On the 14th of April 2020, the government of Mozambique bans public and private events with more than 300 people.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
